page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Except for the marshy edge of the Eden estuary and the few steep slopes which are either grass or shrub. The entire area is cultivated farmland .Six large farms, each over 150 hectares in size and one small farm cover the area. They are mainly owner-occupied. The small farm and the one large farm are run as dairy farms, while the rest are mixed farms with both cash crops and beef cattle fattening. Principal 'cash' crops are barley, potatoes and oil seed rape, with the occasional field of peas; while rotation grass, for grazing and silage, and turnips are the main 'fodder' crops. All the farms are highly mechanised; most have huge new barns reflecting the changed methods of storing grain, potatoes and hay. Silage pits and silos are also common.
